assessment_comment: This is two 1.55 m pipes plus a 0.6 m overflow. North large pipe has strange apron on inlet. Stream is deeply insized (2.5 m deep) within agricultural field on downstream side. No riparian for approximately 70 m down stream on right bank. Stream is partially dewatered with stagnant pools throughout. Dam is documented upstream and may be influencing flow. channel is choked downstream with grasses in many places indicating flow is not occurring year around.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2883939. 12:57:11

Was modelled as open bottom structure. Larger drainage within agricultural fields both upstream and downstream. Heavily impacted riparian with primarily field on either side upstream and downstream. Channel choked out with agronomic grasses. Mostly dewatered except for intermittent stagnant pools.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2077140. 13:48:59

Dry at time of survey. Abundant gravels throughout. Crossing on railway downstream still needs to be assessed. Modelled crossing below. The railway does not exist according to aerial imagery. First 5 m of pipe is rusted through on the bottom side. Deeply incised banks upstream indicate the stream has a lot of flow at sometimes in the year with a decent amount of power.          Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2069497. 10:56:54

Small stream, with very good flow immediately adjacent to the main stem of the Endako River. Could be valuable Chinook rearing area during high flow periods. Pipe is bent in the middle so top half is backwatered but the bottom half is not. Small outlet drop.  There is a large lump in the road at the pipe and pylons have been set up here likely to warn drivers.     12:11:02

Dry at time of survey. Stream may be channelized upstream due to driveways to private properties on either side of the stream. Appears to have narrow, but decently, healthy cottonwood dominated riparian, which could help dissipate flows and floods and runoff. Crack in Highway at culvert with minor erosion of road prism on downstream side. Stream labelled as Ross creek on signed.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793864. 12:42:58

Dry with very poorly defined channel, upstream, and downstream. Seems very unlikely that this system could support fish. Pipe is rusted right through at the Internet for the first metre or so. Pipe is in very bad shape. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793794. 13:41:54

Dry at time of survey. Upstream channel is choked with reed canary grass. Downstream is extremely thick willow with multiple channels present. Stream provides access to Drywilliam lake. Road fill was measured at 12m, but changed to 9.9 to satisfy provincial submission requirements.              Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793348. 14:31:28
Small drainage. Dry with primarily vegetated channel indicating does not flow much of the year. Culvert rusting at inlet. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1794274. 10:53:44

100% backwatered at time of assessment. Beaver dams downstream backwatering the crossing. Pipe and road prism in great shape. Fully passable for all species and life stages at the time of assessment. Some small amount of embeddedment but only for a small piece of the pipe diameter.   Known Chinook system with significant restoration works upstream.       Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 2678. 11:25:13

Very nice stream with good flow and abundant travels upstream and downstream. Landowner indicated sockeye spotted along shoreline years ago. Massive outlet drop. Deserves habitat confirmation, and consideration for replacement if no natural barriers upstream.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1790951. 12:12:56

Very nice little stream with excellent flow for this time of year on a dry year. Crossing downstream on gala Bay Road was fully embedded and passible at the time of the assessment. There is a historic chinook observation within this stream. This could be valuable Chinook, rearing habitat and connectivity within the system should be restored, should no natural barriers be observed on a habitat confirmation assessment.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1794198. 12:47:26

Very nice stream with excellent flow for this time of year on a dry year. Fish observed upstream. Very large deep outlet pool with extensive erosion under cutting the main pipe and 0.6 m overflow. Connected to the Nechako River with observed Chinook points immediately adjacent to the confluence.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3340138. 13:43:26

Extreme negative impacts due to cattle, particularly upstream of the FSR. Extensive trampling of the channel and banks, along with heavy grazing and removal of riparian. Dry at the time of assessment besides a small wallowing hole upstream of the inlet. Riparian, exclusion fencing is required along with repairing vegetation, restoration irrigation, and monitoring.   This is a fish bearing stream with high habitat, values less than 2 km down the stream.                  14:17:41

Two pipes at 0.6 m each. Agricultural field downstream. Appears that the stream has been modified to put the stream in the ditch of the agricultural field. Aird lake upstream with rainbow trout presence. Dry channel. Very small stream. Massive outlet drops. May have historically provided some rearing refuge for wetted periods of the year.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975643. 09:41:29

Dry at tme of assessment. On assessed crossing on private driveway located downstream.          Stream is completely trampled and barely recognizable upstream due to cattle trampling and riparian removal. Downstream is ditch like with just grass and shrub riparian before mix forest begins proximately 40 m downstream of the road. Agricultural field on right back downstream.          Some scouring of the channel downstream, but primarily choked with glasses indicating stream does not flow for much of the year lately.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975651. 10:20:58

Dry at time of assessment. Two other crossings located upstream on non-active forestry roads. Extensive beaver activity upstream with water above both upstream crossings. Could consider opportunity for upgrading this Crossing, and removing the upper two. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1976780. 12:17:51
Moti major structure. Beaverdam located approximately 30 m downstream has back watered the entire structure.  Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 3755. 13:13:41
Huge system with wide channel. Hundreds of fry spotted upstream and some in culvert. Deep outlet pool suggesting culvert may be undersized. Would benefit from bridge replacement.  09:13:29

Grassy wetland habitat upstream and downstream. Culvert diameter used as channel width and stream slope estimated. Beaver grate present at inlet. Some flow in culvert.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1808533. 09:55:51

Two culverts, only left one has water flowing through. Left one is warped in the middle. Very deep outlet pool. Wetland habitat upstream. Agricultural land downstream, with defined channel and good flow.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1802380. 10:16:56
Stream section is part of rehab project. Not a fish passage issue at this time. Good habitat downstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 26621. 11:25:02

No water in culvert. Dewatered upstream. Some standing water in outlet pool, then dewaters downstream. Clear signs of cattle intruding into channel upstream.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1808528. 12:00:12

Three culverts. Water flowing through two pipes. The other one is dewatered, looks like it was installed too high. Overgrown channel upstream. Downstream glows through agricultural land. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1807160. 12:30:04
Fully dewatered. Very small culvert. Signs of a stream channel but doesn't look like there has been water flowing in years.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806918. 13:57:33
No water in pipe. Periodic pools of standing water upstream and downstream but no flowing water. Habitat looks like it would be good during higher flow.  14:51:44
Huge outlet pool, but no drop. No water in pipe and no flowing water in stream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1803926. 15:09:18
Dewatered. No well defined stream channel. Three culverts, diameter totaled. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1801577. 15:44:14

High quality habitat upstream, wide channel with good flow. Lots of instruments vegetation near culvert. Not a major fish passage issue at this time. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 30525. 09:33:54
Good habitat quality downstream. Worse upstream, overgrown and smaller channel. Significant outlet drop, barrier to smaller fish. 10:44:11
Two pipes, approx 15m apart but part of same system. No flowing water through either. Signs of beaver activity upstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3343588. 11:05:23

Big wetland upstream, beaver gate at inlet. Big debris jam in middle of culvert. Only water in pipe near inlet. Dewatered channel downstream at time of survey. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1797338. 11:44:44

High habitat value, wide channel with good flow and gravels. Culvert is very damaged near outlet. There are holes on bottom of pipe about 5m from outlet where water is running through and under the pipe. Culvert is angled down near outlet. Barrier that is a very good candidate for replacement.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806163. 12:15:10
Inlet almost completely blocked by debris and wood. Wetland upstream. Beaver dam blocking most of water just downstream of outlet pool. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804629. 13:01:50

Big, deep outlet pool. Water is flowing from inlet under the pipe for ~10m and then entering pipe through small hole and then flowing in pipe to outlet. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804624. 13:44:39
Dewatered, no well defined stream channel. Agricultural fields on both sides. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804664. 14:18:04
Very small channel, Agricultural fields upstream and downstream of crossing with no tree cover. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1800221. 14:39:14
Dewatered, cow field upstream with no defined channel. Small channel downstream with no water. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1807349. 15:54:33
Landowner reports there hasn't been water in stream since the spring. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806660. 10:18:36

Dewatered stream, small amount of water in outlet pool. Appears to be big outlet drop when the stream is flowing. No well defined channel upstream. Channel width and gradient estimated as areas immediately upstream and downstream are fenced off. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1801616. 10:37:09

Two pipes. Dewatered stream. Appears to be big outlet drop and deep outlet pool when stream was flowing in the past. Debris jam near outlet blocking channel. Grassy habitat upstream, with small channel. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1802489. 11:10:27
Dewatered stream. Very small channel upstream. Culvert was installed deep down into the valley. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1801777. 11:40:33
Dewatered stream. Small channel downstream. Inlet side is fenced off by barb wire Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1801803. 12:10:19

Three pipes. Dewatered stream. Culverts look old and near end of life. Grassy channel going through agricultural field upstream. Big debris jam blocking inlet of middle culvert. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806925. 12:39:13

Very big outlet drop and deep outlet pool. Tricky of water flowing through culvert. Dewatered downstream of outlet pool and dewatered upstream of culvert. Channel width taken upstream but channel is wider downstream of crossing. Culvert is warped and a little corroded. Definitely a barrier to fish passage even at higher flows. 13:09:19
Very big outlet drop. Small channel upstream, grassy habitat near crossing. Bigger channel downstream with much better looking habitat. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806169. 15:41:05
Very nice stream with high habitat quality. Nice gravels and wide channel. Two pipes that look very old. But still passable. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1794329. 16:59:42

Two pipes, both with similar outlet drops. Inlet side has extensive beaver activity. Dams are covering the inlet, culverts are not visible. Huge wetland upstream. Very big outlet pool, depth estimated. Needs to be replaced, or beaver activity managed. Habitat looks good downstream. High habitat value at crossing upstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793922. 17:26:25

Dewatered stream. Big, wide outlet pool with some water in it, could be rainwater. Pipe very corroded on outlet side. Wide stream channel upstream with ok habitat. Grassy channel downstream.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3738843. 08:55:03
Wetland upstream and downstream. Culvert blocked with some debris and overgrown with vegetation. Probably hasn't been flow through pipe in a while. 09:26:55

Moderate flow, wide stream with nice gravels upstream. Runs through rural area. Big outlet drop and deep pool. Erosion and embankment issues above culvert on outlet side. Rainbow confirmed downstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3100663. 11:36:12
Dewatered stream. Wide channel, private land on both sides. Culvert looks old and corroded, abundant fines in barrel. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076438. 12:44:04

Dewatered stream. Small pool near outlet, probably from rain. Rainbow confirmed in past upstream. 2 3m falls upstream. Culvert is very old, corroded and has small holes in bottom. If stream was flowing water would run under pipe. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076418. 13:18:49
Two pipes. Debris jam blocking majority of inlet on both pipes. Dewatered stream, wide channel. Moderate outlet drop on both culverts. 13:50:33

Dewatered stream at time of survey. Wide channel, abundant boulders downstream of crossing. Rainbow confirmed upstream in past. Culvert is old and corroded badly on outlet side. Stream most likely flows under culvert near outlet during high flow. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076407. 14:15:04

Very long culvert length and high fill depth, two pipes. Mostly dewatered stream. Small pools upstream, stagnant water. Small, confined channel. Can't see the other end of pipe, culvert slope estimated. Might be some blockage or culvert is bent in middle. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076402. 14:49:25

Small fry spotted in culvert and in outlet pool. Two pipes, both old and corroded. Small holes in both pipes causing some water to flow under pipe. Very low fill depth, culverts almost at highway. Near Burns Lake, in residential area. Habitat looks good upstream. RB and LSU upstream in Guyishton Lake. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2070299. 15:48:58

Culvert almost fully embedded except for small section at inlet side. Small fish seen in culvert and upstream of crossing. Moderate flow, wide channel. RB confirmed upstream in past. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 3880. 16:36:18
Culvert is fully submerged on inlet side. Outlet side barely visible. Wetland/grassy habitat upstream and downstream. Stagnant water present in pools. No flow. 17:02:58

Very wide channel, culvert is undersized and perched. Deep outlet pool and huge outlet drop. Small fish seen in outlet pool. RB confirmed in past upstream and downstream. Waterfalls way upstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2069556. 11:11:26

Near entrance to lumber yard. Barrier just upstream. Railway downstream has not been assessed yet. Big outlet drop with very deep pool. Wide stream channel with low water levels. RB upstream. 11:25:01

Culverts runs underneath highway and railway. Outlet could not be found. Possible buried. But Creek found below railway and followed to the Endako confluence. Beaver grate on inlet side. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793819. 13:07:39

Dewatered stream. RB, LKC and LSU confirmed upstream in past. Foster Creek joins this stream just upstream of crossing. Old culvert, bent in middle. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1793375. 14:27:03
Dewatered stream. Fenced off private land on both sides. Small outlet drop. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3343582. 15:19:42

Fully backwatered at outlet wetland habitat upstream and downstream. Beaver in culvert at time of survey. Small debris jam at outlet. Fish presence confirmed just downstream of culvert. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1795039. 15:51:16

Fish presence confirmed in past upstream and downstream. Wide stream channel, dewatered at time of survey. Small pool near outlet, no flow.  Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 3743. 16:09:38
Dewatered stream. Very small channel, hard to find. Overgrown and little stream substrate present. Upstream fenced off, on private land. 09:24:18

Dewatered stream. Upstream is in fenced off private land, no clear channel visible. More obvious channel downstream of crossing. Moderate outlet drop with big dry area that looks like it would be an outlet pool when the stream is flowing.  09:45:55

Two pipes, they're closer together at outlet compared to inlet so they must be bent in middle. Dewatered stream. Fenced off private land downstream. Little riparian and evidence of cattle trampling. Upstream is in better shape, small channel visible. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804941. 10:17:48

Dewatered stream. Fenced off private field upstream. Wide open grassy floodplain with little riparian and no channel visible. Downstream has wide area at outlet where pool used to be. Signs of stream channel to right of outlet. Evidence of livestock trampling and/or big game near outlet. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804931. 11:06:49

Culvert runs under active highway construction  site. Inlet could not be accessed. Looks like they are excavating near inlet. Possible bridge construction? Stream is mostly dewatered but there is some stagnant water in culvert. Baffles in pipe. Habitat downstream looks good, with abundant woody debris and healthy riparian. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1804902. 11:33:26

Numerous baffles in pipe. Smaller secondary culvert next to main pipe but installed higher up so likely doesn't get much water. Little amount of flow in pipe but stops just short of outlet, most likely due to small split in pipe. Wide shallow outlet pool but no drop. Abundant algae on stream substrate upstream. RB and WSU confirmed up and downstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1802792. 12:18:02

Dewatered upstream and downstream. Small steps in culvert, containing pools with water but no flow. Efforts being made upstream to restore riparian vegetation, fencing and saplings present. No clear channel downstream. Fish confirmed upstream in 2020.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975143. 13:34:52

2 pipes. Wetland area upstream, beaver grate on inlet. Signs of beaver activity, dam near outlet. Hard to determine stream channel width, combined culvert diameter used. Little trickle flowing through one pipe but other one is dewatered. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975493. 14:05:44

Outlet drop but no pool. Small amount of flow in pipe. Holes in bottom of pipe near outlet where water is flowing through and under. Very murky, turbid water upstream with no flow. Abundant boulders around outlet. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3773627. 14:57:37

4 pipes seen at outlet but only 2 bigger ones visible on inlet side. Only one big pipe has flowing water, has beaver grate on inlet. Small debris jam in front of inlet, likely from beaver. Upstream is grassy with little riparian on banks near crossing. Downstream is different, good habitat and wide channel. Very deep, wide outlet pool. Small fish seen in pool.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3773624. 15:48:26

Chinook confirmed in past upstream. Major trib of Chelako River. Appears to be passable but should be replaced with bridge. Two pipes, only one had water flowing through at time of survey. Small outlet drop. Abundant boulders present downstream. High value habitat upstream with wide channel and gravels present. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 4166. 16:33:33

Two pipes but only one is functioning and has small amount of flow through it. Very small channel. Flows into Beaverley Creek which has known salmonids. This trib has low value habitat, likely not used by spawners. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975199. 16:46:37

Small stream, very close to Chelako confluence. Very big outlet drop but no deep outlet pool. Abundant gravels upstream, ok habitat. Definite barrier to fish.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1975638. 09:45:56

Dewatered stream, small channel with little to no gravels or cobbles. Low value habitat. 2 pipes but only one is functioning. The other pipe is not visible at outlet. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3389486. 10:26:08

Two pipes and one overflow pipe. Small amount of flow through one pipe. Wetland type habitat downstream with beaver dam near outlet. Medium sized channel downstream with medium value habitat with functional woody debris and some gravels. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1976123. 13:17:26

Nice stream with good flow and abundant gravel throughout low gradients. Adjacent property is northern wildlife design. Crossing is currently 100% backwaters and possible to all life stages and species at these lower flow levels.                    Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076441. 12:01:27

Major beaver activity with inlet of pipe 3/4 blocked by mud. 0.6m overflow pipe also present. Low gradient, willow dominated beaver influenced floodplain habitat upstream and downstream. Pipe is back watered however, the inlet is blocked so fish passage not happening at time of assessment.    Crossing on railway upstream, not yet assessed.                 Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2077136. 14:10:33

Two pipes at 1.8 m each north pipe slightly lower than south pipe at outlet. Good side stream with great flow for this time of year on a dry year. Abundant black algae on gravel and cobble substrate. Very nice stream. Appears to have decent riparian health adjacent to the crossing but riparian buffer to be enlarged particularly on upstream south side           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2070691. 09:42:44

Three 4 m diameter pipes. All three pipes are 100% back watered. Road prism and pipes appear to be in good condition. Extensive beaver activity, upstream and downstream.           Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 3812. 11:35:39

Stream is extremely impacted by cattle ranching. Banks eroded and trampled. Algae indicates nutrient inputs from cows are high. Pipes are old with a lot of rust. Habitat value is currently very poor, but historically wouldâ€™ve been high. Still a good amount of flow for a dry year.  100% backwatered however, depth of the water is only approximately 1 cm. Absolutely no riparian vegetation or cattle exclusion fencing on the upstream side for as far as the eye can see.(approximately 1 km.).           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1790770. 15:33:57

Agricultural land on both sides and cow pasture downstream. Fully backwatered culvert with no flow. Cows seen intruding into the stream channel at time of survey. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1799951. 10:55:03

Wetland habitat upstream and downstream. Huge beaver dam on inlet side, creating drop. Adjacent landowner Ron reports there are no fish near this location. He reports that beaver activity increased significantly in the past few years, that is the only reason there is water here.  Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 30585. 13:09:51
Wetland upstream and downstream. A lot of beaver activity upstream, big pond near inlet. Culvert is very warped on inlet side. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806178. 09:56:44
Very small channel downstream, wider upstream. Small amount of flow, grassy wetland habitat. Not likely fish bearing stream section. 13:50:05
Wetland downstream. No defined channel seen upstream. 13:56:33
Not a flowing stream. Horse field downstream. Fenced off on both sides of pipe. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1806217. 08:23:29

Long pipe, no outlet drop but culvert is partially backwatered at outlet. Small fish spotted in outlet pool. Upstream goes into private land and is fenced off. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 2076443. 12:13:13

Backwatered at outlet but some flow upstream and downstream. Some gravels upstream. Private property on both sides. RB confirmed upstream. Downstream railway crossing yet to be assessed. Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 3100655. 09:23:27
Wetland downstream and upstream. Stream channel upstream is more defined. Pipe is fully backwatered. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 2141. 12:21:46

Obvious signs of beaver activity. Big dam near inlet and small dam just downstream of outlet as well. Small channel downstream with no water, no obvious channel upstream due to wetland habitat.  Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1976775. 12:19:45

There are three 1.5m pipes located under railway Avenue continuing all the way under the railway line.  Pipes are inbedded at or more than 50% of their depth. Stream was dry at the time of assessment and scoured channels indicate a fairly small system.           15:25:25
Wide channel, moti major structure. Fully embedded with stream substrate in barrel. 3m falls upstream. Ministry of Transportation chris_hwy_structure_road_id: 3811. 09:56:11

Two pipes (1.2m and 0.6m). 100% backwater. Guessing the pipes are in bed it but cannot see due to poor water quality. This stream is extremely impacted by poor cattle ranching practices. There is no riparian, fencing, and cattle have completely trampled. All the banks, there is no riparian, vegetation, and water quality is extremely poor. This stream could likely be very productive for chinook and other species, if eventually restored.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1795014. 16:01:11

Good flow. Abundant gravel downstream, and upstream. Pipes are both fully in bedded with partial back watering. Chinook point on the stream immediately adjacent to the site. Upstream left bank riparian has been cleared for what appears to be a parking space.           Ministry of Transportation chris_culvert_id: 1790947. 11:54:44
Dry channel. Bridge. 14:56:53
Pipe arch. Passable. 17:53:31
Bridge with sign from Fraser lake sawmills. Extensive cattle trampling underneath the bridge, but some decent amount of water at this location.           14:46:03
Bridge. Good flow 15:02:17
Restoration work conducted at this crossing. No flowing water at time of survey. Livestock field upstream. Goats seen trampling through stream channel. 09:59:33
Deactivated road. Ford passable by 4x4 vehicles  11:50:24
Deactivated road. Old culverts seen in pictures, now a ford. 16:15:48
Small trail, wide channel. 10:00:48
